Leaves: Rosette leaves deeply divided up to 10 cm long, upper leaves less divided. Oval or lance shaped. Greyish green overall appearance.
Flowers: Typical Brassica flowers, bright yellow with 4 petals, in clusters at end of stems.
Habitat: Crops, pastures, rangelands, open woodlands, roadsides.
DistinguishingFeatures: Very hard to distinguish from other Sisymbrium but combination of characteristics.
